place_of_publication.publication_title: Trans. Amer. Philos. Soc., n. s.

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Heliantheae;subtribe Helianthinae;genus Helianthus;species silphioides;

taxon_name.authority: F. T. McFarland & W. A. Anderson

bio:treatment.discussion: Similar to Helianthus atrorubens, H. silphioides is distinguished by shorter hairs (less than 2 mm) on stems proximally and on abaxial leaf midveins, and by petioles of basal leaves less than 1/2 lengths of blades and winged less than 1/2 their lengths. As befits the name, specimens of H. silphioides (and also H. atrorubens) are not infrequently misidentified as species of Silphium.
